page.title: 07A COUNTRY LANE IN WILMSLOW
page.content: { Halmans Lane}is a dirt track through grazing land leading to a wood. The house down the lane was built over 130 years old. It is owned by the Uttleys. { We questioned some{walkers in}the lane. Mr.{Staniforth}told us that he had been walking down the lane to exercise his dog for 6 months. Mrs. {Bracegirdle }has enjoyed regular walks down the lane for 68 years. There are many wild plants, brambles being the most common. In our bird survey we spotted blackbirds, a hawk, a cuckoo and a sparrow.There is a lot of insect life, we spotted some flies, water boatmen, a pond skater, moths and butterflies. People value the lane as it is and would oppose any development that threatened its recreational use.
